content.description:
Ipse inter primos praestanti corpore Turnus 
vertiturvertitur = “positions himself” arma tenens et toto verticevertex, -icis, f. = caput, -itis supra est. 
Cui triplicitriplex, -icis, adj.: triple crinitacrinitus, -a, -um, adj.: long-haired iubā iuba, -ae, f.: crestgaleagalea, -ae, f.: helmet alta ChimaeramChimaera, -ae, f.: Chimaera (a fire-breathing monster) 
sustinet AetnaeosAetnaeus, -a, -um, adj.: of Mt. Aetna efflantemefflo, -are: to breathe out faucibusfauces, -ium, f. pl.: jaws ignes.
content.question: Which Latin word does efflantem (line 4) modify?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
